info.datahelix.apirateslife.effect

Class FadeOutEffect

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.datahelix.apirateslife.effect.Effect
      • info.datahelix.apirateslife.effect.FadeOutEffect

  • public class FadeOutEffect
extends Effect
    This class is used to fade out a single entity. The effect is done on the entity itself, and uses the sprite the entity is based. Created 11/2/2016
    Author:
    Adam Torres

    • Field Detail

      • sprite

        private com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Sprite sprite

    • Constructor Detail

      • FadeOutEffect

        public FadeOutEffect(Entity entity,
                     int timeToFade,
                     int delayToFade)
        Fades an entity out, likely after its death. Ensure that implementing classes properly dispose of themselves, as this class does not handle texture disposal (doing so many dispose of the entity's texture before it is due to be disposed of).
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity that will fade out
        timeToFade - The time it will take for the entity to fade out
        delayToFade - The time it will take for the animation to actually start

      • FadeOutEffect

        public FadeOutEffect(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Sprite sprite,
                     int timeToFade,
                     int delayToFade,
                     float x,
                     float y)

    • Method Detail

      • animate

        public void animate(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch batch,
                    float delta)
        This animates the effect by simply drawing the sprite to the batch as the alpha f
        Specified by:
        animate in class Effect
        Parameters:
        batch - the SpriteBatch the animation will be drawn to
        delta - the time between the last frame and the current frame

      • getSprite

        public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Sprite getSprite()

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        This method is left empty and unused in this child class because disposing of the entity's sprite should be handled by the entity class itself.
        Specified by:
        dispose in class Effect
